programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin links up with his pal, Bill Darsinos, to enjoy a tradition from the heart of Bill's Greek culture when they cook a whole lamb on a spit roast.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to a picturesque cattle farm in California's Santa Maria Valley, to hear firsthand from a young pitmaster who has uncovered the secrets of real Santa Maria barbecue.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin heads to the Cherokee National Forest for a day of fly fishing with an old friend, and to cook up their fresh catch over the campfire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to Gainesboro, Tennessee to visit a free-range hog farm, learn about their operations, and grill up a less desired, but no less delicious, cut of hog - pork steaks.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: South Carolina Peach-Glazed Ribs with Rice Middlins
programme.desc: When Pat's friends and fellow barbecue chefs, Bryan Furman and Dr. Howard Conyers, come to town, the guys dig deep into the tricks and traditions of one of Bryan's specialties: pork ribs.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.sub-title: Red Curry Braised Pork with Mustard Greens
programme.desc: Pat Martin is in the frozen tundra of Minnesota to visit his new friend, Chef Yia Vang. They brave the cold and break nearly-frozen ground to barbecue a pig's head in the earth.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin links up with his pal, Bill Darsinos, to enjoy a tradition from the heart of Bill's Greek culture when they cook a whole lamb on a spit roast.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to a picturesque cattle farm in California's Santa Maria Valley, to hear firsthand from a young pitmaster who has uncovered the secrets of real Santa Maria barbecue.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin heads to the Cherokee National Forest for a day of fly fishing with an old friend, and to cook up their fresh catch over the campfire.

programme.title: Barbecue: Life of Fire
programme.desc: Pat Martin travels to Gainesboro, Tennessee to visit a free-range hog farm, learn about their operations, and grill up a less desired, but no less delicious, cut of hog - pork steaks.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares Carne Adovada.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Nashville Hot Pheasant and Mint Basil Lemonade
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern takes a spin on Nashville-style hot fried chicken. Hot and spicy, batter coated, crispy fried pheasant is paired with a spinach salad topped with bacon vinaigrette and ice cold mint basil lemonade.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: For pig roast perfection, Chef Andrew Zimmern marinates a whole hog.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern breaks down a whole tuna and serves it three ways: grilled, raw, and poached.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern starts simmering a classic Italian Bolognese sauce, with ground bison, lots of red wine and tomatoes. Then, he adds marinated bison skirt steak tacos with borracho beans to the tailgate menu.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Goat Curry with Rice Pilaf and Carmelized Onions
programme.desc: Chef Andrew butchers a whole goat, using the leg and backstrap for a braised curry.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern makes two different dishes with red snapper: fried snapper fingers with a spicy chile-orange mayonnaise dipping sauce and a slow-roasted whole fish with an herb salad and charred miso sweet potatoes.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Grilled Turkey Legs, Creamed Greens and Lemon Orzo
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern prepares Grilled Turkey Legs, Creamed Greens and Lemon Orzo.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Quail Noodle Salad and Antelope Stew
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern creates Vietnamese cold noodle salad and grilled quail. Next, chef makes antelope stew.

programme.title: Andrew Zimmern's Wild Game Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Boar Ribs and Shrimp and Grits
programme.desc: Chef Andrew Zimmern makes a homemade barbecue rub, basting sauce and barbecue sauce for wild boar ribs. Next, chef shares his twist on a classic southern shrimp and grits recipe, adding a side of beautiful wild mushrooms.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati travels to Sonora's coast on the Sea of Cortez, where local legend To침o Contreras gives her a tour including shellfish on the beach, his restaurant Mariscos El Rey, and his home kitchen for some crave-worthy recipes.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati makes three classic Sonoran recipes- a fish special called pescado zarandeado, a rich stew called gallina pinta, and a tasty dirty rice with clams. In Sonora, she visits vacation destination Puerto Pe침asco.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati prepares a true Sonoran feast for the crew - Sonora cheese soup, chicken in pecan and ancho chile sauce.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati makes traditional tamales with corn, chiles, and cheese, and then for the main course, pork chops topped with a pickled grape salad. In Sonora, she visits a traditional hacienda, where she gets a true taste of Sonoran ranch food.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati explores the culinary highlights of Jalisco's capital city, Guadalajara. She starts at a street cart to taste the city's most iconic sandwich, tortas ahogadas. Then, she meets one of the city's best chefs, Fabian Delgado.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati explores some unique spots in Guadalajara where food and art truly connect. In her kitchen, she makes pollo a la valentina, rice with poblanos and corn, and an almond tres leches cake.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: In Guadalajara, Pati learns the secrets to menudo and birria. In her kitchen, Pati perfects her own recipes for a few Jalisco favorites: menudo, tepache, and jericalla.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati learns about the history, the instruments, and the meaning behind Mariachi music . Pati makes carne en su jugo, tres chiles guacamole, and masa berry shortcake.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati experiences the Escaramuza- An all-female horse riding and skills competition. In the kitchen, Pati makes Jalisco-style birria and her friend, pastry chef and cookbook author Fany Gerson, joins her to make gelatinas for dessert.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati meets chef and historian Maru Toledo who is working to preserve and pass on some of Jalisco's most important regional recipes. Pati makes Jalisco-style chicken tamales and chile relleno rice dressed with salsa roja.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati meets the young chefs behind one of Guadalajara's most exciting restaurants, Xokol. Back home, Pati invites her friend Francisco Migoya over to make conchas to go with pellizcadas with chicharr칩n in salsa verde.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati visits the birthplace of Mexico's most famous spirit, the town of Tequila. Back home Pati makes a brunch of corn tortilla egg nests with salsa verde con chile de 치rbol and traditional arroz rojo.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati is in one of Mexico's most popular beach destinations - Puerto Vallarta. She gets an insider's tour of the best street food from one of the town's most acclaimed chefs, Thierry Boulet.

programme.title: Pati's Mexican Table
programme.desc: Pati celebrates everyone's favorite Mexican creation, the taco. In her kitchen, Pati creates a pair of Jalisco-inspired tacos and a Ceviche tostada that are sure to satisfy any true taco-lover.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie visits Basilicata in search of some old school Italian recipes and meets a family of shepherds and an 89-year-old macaroni master.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie gets a masterclass in Sicilian sweets and cooking up an epic tuna, prawn and pistachio spaghetti. There's also some chocolaty cannoli.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie is taking spaghetti bolognese to the next level and re-creating a mind-blowing Jewish-Italian recipe. There's also beef stew with pappardelle.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie is high up in the Italian Alps cooking some great comfort food, including dumplings, mind-blowing macaroni cheese, and a classic red wine and sausage risotto.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.sub-title: Best of Salina's Land and Sea
programme.desc: Jamie returns to cooking the food he loves the most, getting right to heart of the Italian kitchen.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie visits the pizza capital of Italy to learn recipes from the locals and tries acquapazza, fish poached in crazy water.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie heads for one of the hottest food destinations in Italy, making hand-crafted pasta, a special seafood stew, and the region's answer to paella.

programme.title: Jamie Oliver Cooks Italy
programme.desc: Jamie tracks down some fast, fresh and easy recipes, featuring tasty minty pea tortiglioni and gnocchi with roasted tomato sauce and rocket pesto.
